CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1958, pg. 2 reads: " Bethany Members Vote - Members of Bethany Baptist Church formed a line at court-regulated election meeting, passed by large facsimile billboard of election ballot, rear of which is shown between first two members on left in voting line, and had names checked by attorneys and leaders from both sides and the moderator, Atty. Oliver Johnson and his son and assistant, Atty. Livingstone Johnson, back to camera at left. (Atty. Oliver Johnson has hand on son's shoulder.) Names were checked on mimeographed, agreed membership lists, and printed ballots deposited in voting box at left of picture.  At right is Deacon Thomas H. Lee and Attorney Cauley, for anti-McFadden group.  Next to them but hidden are Deacon J.K. Anderson and Atty. Wendell Freeland for the Rev. Mr. McFadden. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Five men, from left: Livingstone Johnson, back to camera, Deacon Thomas H. Lee, Atty. Cauley, Deacon J.K. Anderson, and Atty. Wendell Freeland (hidden), facing men and women voting on the continuation of Rev. Clarence E. McFadden's tenure, in basement of Bethany Baptist Church
